BasicShapes

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • BasicShapes.Animation

  • public class Animation
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores bunch of images to form an animation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Animation(int size, int refreshRate)
      Well we can't have animation without the number of frames and how to quickly to refresh them can we?

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
      Add the given image to the animation.
      boolean addImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image, int index)
      Adds image at the given index.
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
      Returns the image that you request.
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage(int index)
      Returns the image at the given index.
      int getRefreshRate()
      Returns how quickly the given animation changes frames.
      int getSize()
      Returns how many frames the animation has.
      void reset()
      Resets the animation to frame zero and frame refresh zero.
      void setRefreshRate(int refreshRate)
      Change the refresh rate, for example if you have walking animation and you did speed buff, you would want walking animation to increase too.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animation

        public Animation(int size,
         int refreshRate)
        Well we can't have animation without the number of frames and how to quickly to refresh them can we?
        Parameters:
        size - How many frames the animation has.
        refreshRate - How quickly each frame will change.

    • Method Detail

      • setRefreshRate

        public void setRefreshRate(int refreshRate)
        Change the refresh rate, for example if you have walking animation and you did speed buff, you would want walking animation to increase too.
        Parameters:
        refreshRate - The new refresh rate for the animation.

      • getRefreshRate

        public int getRefreshRate()
        Returns how quickly the given animation changes frames. I don't know why you would want it, but there ya go.
        Returns:
        The refresh rate of this animation.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns how many frames the animation has.
        Returns:
        The amount of frames animation has.

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage(int index)
        Returns the image at the given index. If incorrect index is specified (less than zero or more than the size), then null is returned.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of tha frame you want.
        Returns:
        null if index is invalid, the frame at the given index if it is correct.

      • addImage

        public boolean addImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Add the given image to the animation. If Animation can not handle more frames than initially set, then the image will not be added.
        Parameters:
        image - Image that you would like to add.
        Returns:
        True if the image was added to the animation, false otherwise.

      • addImage

        public boolean addImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
               int index)
        Adds image at the given index. If index is invalid value (bigger than size or less than zero), then false is returned and the image is not added. Otherwise image is added and true is returned. Very useful method to override image in the animation.
        Parameters:
        image - Image that you would like to add to the animation.
        index - Index at which to add the given image.
        Returns:
        True if the image was added, and false otherwise.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the animation to frame zero and frame refresh zero.

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
        Returns the image that you request. Keep calling this method and the image will keep on changing. This is the animation method. If animation is incomplete be careful when calling this method.
        Returns:
        Different image every time depending on the frame and time.
